qas.question: Who were the Seven Nations of Canada?

answers.text: These were Native Americans of the Laurentian valley

qas.question: Which tribe was the enemy of the Seven Nations of Canada?

answers.text: the Seven Nations were interested in fighting against the Iroquois

qas.question: How much help did the Seven Nations give the French in the Ohio Valley?

answers.text: the Seven Nations were not directly concerned with the fate of the Ohio River Valley

qas.question: Who was the European partner of the Iroquois?

answers.text: The Iroquois, dominant in what is now Upstate New York, sided with the British

qas.question: How valuable was the Iroquois alliance with Britain?

answers.text: The Iroquois, dominant in what is now Upstate New York, sided with the British but did not play a large role in the war

context: During the war, the Seven Nations of Canada were allied with the French. <a0_0>These were Native Americans of the Laurentian valley<a0_0/>—the Algonquin, the Abenaki, the Huron, and others. Although the Algonquin tribes and <a2_0>the Seven Nations were not directly concerned with the fate of the Ohio River Valley<a2_0/>, they had been victims of the Iroquois Confederation. The Iroquois had encroached on Algonquin territory and pushed the Algonquins west beyond Lake Michigan. Therefore, the Algonquin and <a1_0>the Seven Nations were interested in fighting against the Iroquois<a1_0/>. Throughout New England, New York, and the North-west Native American tribes formed differing alliances with the major belligerents. <a3_0><a4_0>The Iroquois, dominant in what is now Upstate New York, sided with the British<a3_0/> but did not play a large role in the war<a4_0/>.
